body.p:
Kenton County Ky Feb. 6th/65
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir:

I am Justice of the Peace in the 1st dist (county) in Kenton County and hereby tender my resignation of sd office. I also beg leave to recommend to your excellency for appointment to sd office Lewis Richardson Esqr whom I am satisfied the people of the Dist. desire to fill the office He was magistrate under election some years ago and resigned & enlisted in the service of the United States & has served in the Military service Some 3 years & 4 months & has been Honorably discharged He belonged to the 23rd Ky Vol Infantry Ky.

Respectfully
Landrum Hampton, J. P. K. C

I am constable in the above district & am satisfied the appointment as above recommended will as a good appointment suit the people & in fact know of no other man who would take this office & suit the place.

We are satisfied the appointment of Mr Lewis Richardson Esqr. will be perfectly satisfactory and a judicious appointment, as magistrate in the 1st dist. Kenton County (county,) We know him well and cheerfully recommend him to your Excellency.

C H Mooer
Benj Egelston J. P. K. C
R. Richardson
If appointed to the above office I will accept the appointment qualify and endeaver to do justice in the discharge of the duties thereof

Respectfully
Lewis Richardson
P. O. Covington Ky,

Justices Peace
Kenton Co
L. Hampton
Resignation & appointment of L. Richardson
9th Feby 1865
